page.title: 19LES SALT.CITIZEN 1985.
page.content: Mr Les Salt is regarded locally as a pillar of Langwith Society.He has represented his community in a variety of capacities from being the first Head boy at Whaley Thorns School to his present positions as Secretary Treasurer of the Dramatic Society,St Lukes Mens Fellowship and the local Floral Art Society His employment by the now disbanded Pleasley and Pleasley Hill Co-op Society,spanned 41years,18 as a branch manager.Called up in 1940,Les spent the 1939-45 war at the 14th Army Headquarters of Earl Mountbatten.During 2years in India and 18months in Burma he achieved the rank of sergeant and was mentioned in despatches.As a self taught artist,Les has developed a reputation for his oil paint interpretations of the local landscape,some of which have gone to America,Canada,Australia and Germany.
